title: RPC personal_getAddress calls in succession crashes geth
body:
running geth with the following:

 geth --rpc --rpcport 4000 --rpcaddr 127.0.0.1 --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3,personal"

If I run the following command more than once geth crashes:

 curl http://127.0.0.1:4000 --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"personal_newAccount","params":[ "password" ],"id":1}'
curl: (52) Empty reply from server

In fact I have now noticed any concurrent RPC calls to 'personal' methods, such as personal_unlockAccount or personal_newAccount cause the geth client to crash.

Thanks for the report. Seems to be a bug that we're aware of. Key handling does a tad too many disk file operations and many of them in parallel can overload some OS/Go runtime limitations. https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/2221 reduces disk accesses a bit, and @fjl planned a further update that should also significantly reduce disk access for account management.
We were running geth on an 8GB dev server. On a 32GB server we have not experienced the problem. So it seems it could be related to some sort of GO memory issue / bug.
